isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 2.3: PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - T 444E ENGINE - EST TOOL-FAULT CODES

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to Table 2.18
for the EST tool fault codes test.

table.title: Table 2.18 EST Tool - Fault Codes FROM FORM EGED - 195

entry.para: See Electronic Diagnostic Form for Codes

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if the Electronic Control Module (ECM) has detected any fault conditions that would cause a hard or no start condition.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure

note.para: Turn all accessories and the IGNITION OFF, before connecting EST tool to ATA diagnostic connector.

svcsubproc.para:
Connect the Electronic Service Tool (EST) to the American Trucking Association (ATA) diagnostic connector. The connector is located on the lower left kick panel Figure 2.43
inside the cab. On school buses, it may be hidden by the body builders panel near the driver's left foot. The screen of the reader should light up as soon as the tool is plugged in.

note.para: The ATA connector supplies power to operate the EST. The EST will automatically power up as soon as it is plugged into the ATA connector.

svcsubproc.para: Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position, but do not start the engine. This will allow the EST to receive data from the electronic control components on the truck. Press "ENTER" for Navistar Engine Control Module. The information received will be data showing the current status of the engine.

figure.caption: Figure 2.43 Electronic Service Tool/ATA Connector Location

svcsubproc.para:
To access the fault codes press the "FUNC" key to switch to the main menu ( Figure 2.44
).

From the main menu press the "↓" key to select " DIAGNOSTIC CODES". The selection will have the "↑↓" symbol on the screen. This means there are other selections available. By pressing the "↓" key the other selections will display on the screen. Press "↓" until "DIAGNOSTIC CODES" appears on the screen. Next press "ENTER".You are now in the diagnostic codes selection of the tool. From this point, diagnostic codes can be accessed.

Refer to Figure 2.47
for the overview of the MPSI Pro-link system.

To access "Inactive Codes" press the "FUNC" key. This will access the last prior selection. Then press the "↓" key to select "INACTIVE CODES" Press the "ENTER" key ( Figure 2.48
).

Inactive codes are faults that have occurred in the previous (ignition) "key ON cycles" and are now stored in memory. An "Active Code" will become an "Inactive" code when the ignition (key) is shut off.
Record all fault codes and refer to Electronics Diagnostics form EGED-200.

note.para: All current fault codes must be repaired (cleared), before proceeding with further diagnostic testing.

svcsubproc.title: Possible Causes
svcsubproc.para: Electronic malfunctions which can be detected by the ECM on a continuous monitor basis.

svcsubproc.title: Supplemental Diagnostics
svcsubproc.para: If fault codes are set, refer to Electronic Diagnostic form EGED-200 and fault code diagnostics.
